question.body: This is the primary force responsible for pushing water and solutes from blood across the filtration membrane and is opposed by two forces that resist the influx of fluids.

response.feedback: Correct. Glomerular hydrostatic pressure pushes water and solutes from blood across the filtration membrane and promotes filtration.
Incorrect. Capsular hydrostatic pressure opposes filtration and is exerted by fluid already in the glomerular capsule.
Incorrect. Blood colloid osmotic pressure opposes filtration and is caused by proteins present in blood plasma such as albumen and fibrinogen.
